MappableColorByObject.label: Color
MappableColorByObject.tooltip: Adjusts the color of the surface. Affects both light bounding off (reflectance) and light passing through (transmittance).

MappableImageFade.label: Image
MappableImageFade.tooltip: Displays the diffuse color map of the material.

Float.label: Image Fade
Float.tooltip: Adjusts the composite between the base color and the diffuse image. Active only when an image is chosen.

MappableFloat.label: Glossiness
MappableFloat.tooltip: Specifies the smoothness of the surface, which affects both reflectivity and transparency. Reduce glossiness to create matte surfaces or frosted glass. Enter a value between 0 (dull) and 100 (a perfect mirror).

Boolean.label: Highlights
Boolean.tooltip: Adjusts adding metallic highlights. Default = non-metallic.

MappableFloat.label: Direct
MappableFloat.tooltip: Adjusts how much light the material reflects when the surface is directly facing the camera. Enter a value between 0 (no reflections) and 100 (maximum reflections).

MappableFloat.label: Oblique
MappableFloat.tooltip: Adjusts how much light the material reflects when the surface is at an angle to the camera. Enter a value between 0 (no reflections) and 100 (maximum reflections).

Float.label: Amount
Float.tooltip: Adjusts the amount of light that passes through a surface rather than reflecting off or being absorbed. Enter a value between 0% (completely opaque) and 100% (completely transparent).

MappableImageFade.label: Image
MappableImageFade.tooltip: Adds an image to combine with the overall transparency amount.

Float.label: Image Fade
Float.tooltip: Controls the composite of image and transparency amount, e.g., the white of the image will be transparent at the overall amount, and the degree to which the black is opaque is determined by the fade value.

MappableFloat.label: Translucency
MappableFloat.tooltip: Adjusts the percentage of light that is absorbed and retranmitted as it passes through the surface, as if the surface were a back-lit movie screen. Enter a value between 0 (not translucent) and 100 (completely translucent, such as frosted glass). Active only when Transparency has a value greater than 0.

FloatMenu.label: Refraction
FloatMenu.tooltip: Adjusts the amount that light bends when it passes through a surface. Active only when Transparency has a value greater than 0. Specify an index number between 0 (no refraction) and 5 (most refraction).

MappableFloat.label: Image
MappableFloat.tooltip: Uses a a texture map to control the shapes cut into the surface of the material.

MappableColor.label: Filter Color
MappableColor.tooltip: Adjusts the color of light transmitted through a transparent or semi-transparent material, such as glass.

FloatMenu.label: Luminance
FloatMenu.tooltip: Adjusts the brightness of the light emitted by this surface, measured in candelas per square meter; e.g., Dim Glow = 10, Halogen Lamp Lens = 10000.

FloatMenu.label: Color Temperature
FloatMenu.tooltip: Adjusts the color temperature (warmth vs. coolness) of the light emitted by this material in degress Kelvin; e.g., Candle = 1850, Xenon Arc Lamp = 6420.

MappableColor.label: Image
MappableColor.tooltip: Uses a texture map to select a bump relief pattern for the material. A bump pattern defines raised and lowered areas based on dark and light areas of an image file.

MappableFloat.label: Amount
MappableFloat.tooltip: Adjusts the relative height of the specified bump pattern. Enter 0 to make the surface flat. Enter higher decimal values (up to 1000.0) to increase the height of the surface irregularities.

StackPanel.label: Ambient Occlusion
StackPanel.tooltip: Enables Ambient Occlusion. Emulates the look of true global illumination by using shaders to calculate the extent that an area is occluded or prevented from receiving incoming light. Use this effect with indirect light.

Integer.label: Samples
Integer.tooltip: Ambient occlusion quality (High= Smoother/Slower; Low= Grainier/Faster)

Float.label: Max Distance
Float.tooltip: Defines the ambient occlusion radius (High= Large coverage area/Slower; Low= Small coverage area/Faster)

Boolean.tooltip: Enables a more complex mode of Ambient Occlusion that takes object color into account. Note: This improves excessive 'corner darkening' and solves the creation of 'dark rims' by AO around self-illuminating objects.

StackPanel.label: Round Corners
StackPanel.tooltip: Enables simulated round corners. Note: This is only a shading effect, similar to a bump map, whereby no actual geometric changes occur. This effect only works properly on straight edges.

MappableFloat.label: Source
MappableFloat.tooltip: Adjusts the radius of the round corner effect.

Boolean.tooltip: Activate to apply corner rounding effects to any material. Disable to apply corner rounding effects to the surface of the current material only.

Integer.label: Reflection Glossy Samples
Integer.tooltip: Defines the maximum number of samples (rays) that mental ray computes to create glossy reflections.

Integer.label: Refraction Glossy Samples
Integer.tooltip: Defines the maximum number of samples (rays) that mental ray computes to create glossy refractions.

Integer.label: Reflection Max Trace Depth
Integer.tooltip: Number of times each ray is reflected. When set to zero, global render settings take precedence.

Integer.label: Refraction Max Trace Depth
Integer.tooltip: When checked, the material's refraction depth is controlled locally and an additional transparency ray will be casted when the limit is reached, limiting the 'dark edge' effect typically found on solid glass objects.
